# Marys A Python library to obtain dining hours and menus at Swarthmore College. Copyright 2021 Bill Dengler Licensed under the [Apache License, Version 2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0) (the "Licence"); you may not use this library except in compliance with the Licence. Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the Licence is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the Licence for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the Licence. If the terms of the licence pose a serious obstacle for your use, please contact the author. ## Getting started ``` python console >>> import marys >>> m=marys.Menu() # Fetch latest menus from The Dash ``` ### JSON API `Menu` objects make the full json API available, so programs that rely on it can start using Marys immediately. ```python console >>> m["sharples"][0]["title"] 'Brunch' >>> m["sharples"][0]["enddate"] '2021-02-07 13:30:00' >>> m["sharples"][0]["description"] 'Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (v) Bacon and Chicken Sausage Homefries Buttermilk Biscuits Lentil Stew and Rice (v) Asparagus Vegan Chili Oatmeal (v) Specialty Salad:  Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry Vinaigrette Grill Item:  Phoenix Sandwiches Dessert:  Donuts' ``` ### Conveniences Marys adds extra features on top of the base API to ease access to the menu. #### `cleaned_description` While the original `description` is provided for backwards compatibility with the original JSON API, there is also a `cleaned_description` more suitable for use inside applications, with resolved HTML entities and cleaned-up formatting. ```python console >>> m["sharples"][0]["cleaned_description"] 'Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (v) Bacon and Chicken Sausage Homefries Buttermilk Biscuits Lentil Stew and Rice (v) Asparagus Vegan Chili Oatmeal (v) Specialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry Vinaigrette Grill Item: Phoenix Sandwiches Dessert: Donuts' ``` #### Access by meal period `Menu` objects contain special `breakfast`, `lunch`, `dinner`, and `current` keys for accessing breakfast, lunch, dinner, or next available meals respectively. Lunch automatically resolves to brunch when necessary. ```python console >>> m["breakfast"] {} >>> m["lunch"] {'sharples': Sharples Dining Hall [Sharples Dining Hall Brunch {'title': 'Brunch', 'startdate': '2021-02-07 10:30:00', 'enddate': '2021-02-07 13:30:00', 'short_time': '10:30am - 1:30pm', 'description': 'Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (v) Bacon and Chicken Sausage Homefries Buttermilk Biscuits Lentil Stew and Rice (v) Asparagus Vegan Chili Oatmeal (v) Specialty Salad:  Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry Vinaigrette Grill Item:  Phoenix Sandwiches Dessert:  Donuts', 'html_description': 'Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (v)

False >>> m["sharples"].open # Is Sharples open for any meal? False >>> m["sharples"][1]["title"] 'Dinner' >>> m["sharples"][1].open # Is Sharples open for dinner? False >>> m["dinner"].open # Is dinner available anywhere right now? False ``` #### String rendering Marys objects have a complete string representation. ```python console >>> str(m["tomorrow"]) "At Sharples Dining Hall Breakfast (07:30–10:00) Lunch (11:30–14:30) Main Entrees: Chicken Fingers and French Fries Vegetable Lo Mein Homestyle Tofu with Green Beans and Rice Corn Soups: Garden Vegetable (v), Chicken Noodle Specialty Salad: Coleslaw Grill Offering: Black Bean Burger, Cheeseburger Dessert: Hope's Homestyle Cookies, and Our Own Vegan Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies (v) indicates vegan option Dinner (16:30–20:00) Main Entrees: Tilapia with Seafood Sauce Rice Pilaf (v) Butternut Sage Orzo (v) Seitan Chimichurri (v) Asparagus Soups: Garden Vegetable (v), Chicken Noodle Specialty Salad: Coleslaw Grill Offering: Turkey Burgers, with or without Cheese Dessert: Strawberry Cheesecake (v) indicates vegan option At Essie Mae's Essie's Open (08:00–15:00) We are open and serving Breakfast and Lunch. We have a wide variety of snacks and Drinks available for purchase. Deli Lunch Special: Corned Beef Reuben Sandwich served with French fries and a choice of drink. For the Safety of our Customers and Staff Essie's will remain takeout only until further notice. " >>> str(m["tomorrow"]["sharples"]) "At Sharples Dining Hall Breakfast (07:30–10:00) Lunch (11:30–14:30) Main Entrees: Chicken Fingers and French Fries Vegetable Lo Mein Homestyle Tofu with Green Beans and Rice Corn Soups: Garden Vegetable (v), Chicken Noodle Specialty Salad: Coleslaw Grill Offering: Black Bean Burger, Cheeseburger Dessert: Hope's Homestyle Cookies, and Our Own Vegan Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies (v) indicates vegan option Dinner (16:30–20:00) Main Entrees: Tilapia with Seafood Sauce Rice Pilaf (v) Butternut Sage Orzo (v) Seitan Chimichurri (v) Asparagus Soups: Garden Vegetable (v), Chicken Noodle Specialty Salad: Coleslaw Grill Offering: Turkey Burgers, with or without Cheese Dessert: Strawberry Cheesecake (v) indicates vegan option " >>> Chicken Noodle Specialty Salad: Coleslaw Grill Offering: Black Bean Burger, Cheeseburger Dessert: Hope's Homestyle Cookies, and Our Own Vegan Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies (v) indicates vegan option" ``` #### Speech rendering Marys objects can be rendered as [Speech Synthesis Markup Language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speech_Synthesis_Markup_Language) for voice assistants and speech systems. ```python console >>> m["tomorrow"].ssml() "At Sharples Dining HallBreakfast (from 7:30am to 10:00am) Lunch (from 11:30am to 2:30pm) Main Entrees: Chicken Fingers and French FriesVegetable Lo MeinHomestyle Tofu with Green Beans and RiceCornSoups: Garden Vegetable (vegan), Chicken NoodleSpecialty Salad: ColeslawGrill Offering: Black Bean Burger, CheeseburgerDessert: Hope's Homestyle Cookies, and Our Own Vegan Banana Chocolate Chip CookiesDinner (from 4:30pm to 8:00pm) Main Entrees: Tilapia with Seafood SauceRice Pilaf (vegan)Butternut Sage Orzo (vegan)Seitan Chimichurri We have a wide variety of snacks and Drinks available for purchase. Deli Lunch Special:Corned Beef Reuben Sandwich served with French fries and a choice of drink. For the Safety of our Customers and Staff Essie's will remain takeout only until further notice." >>> m["sharples"].ssml() 'At Sharples Dining HallBrunch (from 10:30am to 1:30pm) Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (vegan)Bacon and Chicken SausageHomefriesButtermilk BiscuitsLentil Stew and Rice (vegan)AsparagusVegan ChiliOatmeal (vegan)Specialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry VinaigretteGrill Item: Phoenix SandwichesDessert: DonutsDinner (from 4:30pm to 6:30pm) Chicken Cutlets with Mashed Potatoes and GravyLemony Tofu (vegan)Pasta with Marinara (vegan) or Pesto Cream SauceSpinachVegan ChiliSpecialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry VinaigretteGrill Item: Hot DogsDessert: Oreo Cheesecake' >>> m["sharples"][1].ssml() 'Dinner (from 4:30pm to 6:30pm) Chicken Cutlets with Mashed Potatoes and GravyLemony Tofu (vegan)Pasta with Marinara (vegan) or Pesto Cream SauceSpinachVegan ChiliSpecialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry VinaigretteGrill Item: Hot DogsDessert: Oreo Cheesecake' ``` If using this library with Amazon Alexa, Alexa emotions are supported. ```python console >>> m["breakfast"].ssml(dialect=marys.SSMLDialect.AMAZON) 'Dining is currently unavailable at this time!' ``` #### Card rendering Similarly to `ssml`, Marys objects can be represented as a card (object with title and content). These are useful for creating dialog boxes in graphical programs or textual responses for voice assistants like Alexa and Google Assistant. ```python console >>> m["sharples"].card() Card(title='At Sharples Dining Hall', content='Brunch (10:30–13:30) Scrambled Eggs or Tofu Scramble (v) Bacon and Chicken Sausage Homefries Buttermilk Biscuits Lentil Stew and Rice (v) Asparagus Vegan Chili Oatmeal (v) Specialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry Vinaigrette Grill Item: Phoenix Sandwiches Dessert: Donuts Dinner (16:30–18:30) Chicken Cutlets with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy Lemony Tofu (v) Pasta with Marinara (v) or Pesto Cream Sauce Spinach Vegan Chili Specialty Salad: Spinach and Mandarin Oranges with Raspberry Vinaigrette Grill Item: Hot Dogs Dessert: Oreo Cheesecake (v) denotes vegan option ') >>> m["tomorrow"]["essies"][0].card() Card(title="Essie's Open (08:00–15:00)", content="We are open and serving Breakfast and Lunch. We have a wide variety of snacks and Drinks available for purchase. Deli Lunch Special: Corned Beef Reuben Sandwich served with French fries and a choice of drink. For the Safety of our Customers and Staff Essie's will remain takeout only until further notice.") ``` Cards can also be formatted as HTML. ```python console >>> m["tomorrow"].card(html=True) Card(title='Menu', content="

") ``` ## Asynchronous programs For programs using Python's coroutine (`async`/`await`) syntax, a coroutine is provided to asynchronously construct a `Menu` object. If your programs do not use the `async` or `await` keywords, you don't need to use this. ```python m = await marys.Menu.asynchronous() ``` ## What's with the name? This library was named after Mary Kassab, a Sharples manager who often assisted me, a totally blind student, in navigating the dining hall.
